metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7572 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has a buffer over-read in IMA_ADPCM_nibble in audio/SDL_wave.c. It was discovered that SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) did not properly handle certain crafted input, resulting in a heap-based buffer over-read. An attacker could use this to cause SDL to crash or leak sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-0.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-0.1ubuntu0.1').
libsdl2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
